creator: christophe.saillard@crc.u-strasbg.fr
text:
We use Apache 2.0.54 (FreeBSD ports version) with mod_auth_ldap. 

We have a strange problem : 

Authentication works perfecly with most of our logins (when a user type wrong
credentials, the login window reprompt instantly, if the credentials are ok
authentication succeeds without any problem). But, sometimes with one particular
login, the client's browser get stuck (with IE, Firefox, Konqueror, Safari etc.)
even if the credentials are good. Then only way to stop the problem is to
restart apache on the server. This behaviour happened with different random
logins, not especially with one particular.

There's no explicit logs about this problems in httpd-error.log ...

(In reply to comment #0) 
> We have a strange problem : 

We have the same problem (apache 2.0.53 on linux). Your description matches our
problem exactly.
 
> There's no explicit logs about this problems in httpd-error.log ...

That's the only difference here: the error log for the vhost doesn't contain
information about this, but the general apache error log notes a line for each try:

[Sat Jan 07 21:43:59 2006] [notice] child pid 19306 exit signal Segmentation
fault (11)
[Sat Jan 07 21:44:13 2006] [notice] child pid 22100 exit signal Segmentation
fault (11)
[Sat Jan 07 21:44:17 2006] [notice] child pid 21328 exit signal Segmentation
fault (11)

There are many fixes to the LDAP modules in 2.0.55 which can cause random hangs
or crashes, please reopen if you still see problems there.
